children.name: journey
children.definition: especially UKan occasion when you travel from one place to another – used especially about travelling a long distance, or travelling somewhere regularly,for example to school or work: chuyến đi
examples: journey to/from/between
my journey to China
journey through/across etc
a journey across Europe
the friends they madeon the journey
a car/plane/bus etc journeythe six-hour train journey to London

children.name: make a journey
examples: I still use my car, but now I make fewer journeys.

children.name: go on a journey
children.definition: make a long journey
examples: We are going on a journey to a strange country.

children.name: begin/start a journey
examples: He began the journey home across London.

children.name: set off on a journey
children.definition: alsoembark on a journeyformal
examples: (= start a long journey )Before setting off on a journey, look at maps and guidebooks.

children.name: break your journey
children.definition: make a short stop on a journey
examples: We broke our journey to have a picnic.

children.name: continue your journey
examples: We stopped for breakfast, then continued our journey.

children.name: a long journey
examples: They arrived tired from their long journey.

children.name: a two-hour/five-mile journey
examples: They arrived in Nice after an eight-hour journey by car.

children.name: a difficult journey
examples: It was a difficult journey, especially in the winter months.

children.name: a safe journey
children.definition: used especially to wish someone a good journey
examples: Have a safe journey.

children.name: an epic journey
children.definition: a very long and eventful journey
examples: Lewis and Clark made their epic journey across the continental United States in the early 1800s.

children.name: a wasted journey
children.definition: one that did not achieve the result you wanted
examples: To avoid a wasted journey, ring first to check that the event is still on.

children.name: a dangerous/hazardous/perilous journey
examples: They set off on the dangerous journey down the river.

children.name: an arduous journey
children.definition: to a place that is difficult to reach
examples: the arduous journey to the North Pole

children.name: the outward journey
children.definition: the journey to a place
examples: The outward journey seemed long and slow.

children.name: the return journey
children.definition: the journey back from a place
examples: The return journey was uneventful.

children.name: the homeward journey
children.definition: the journey back home
examples: In the car on their homeward journey, they discussed the wedding.

children.name: a leg/stage of a journey
children.definition: one part of a journey
examples: We set off on the final leg of our journey.

children.name: trip
children.usage: [In American English, trip can be used to mean any journey]
children.definition: a journey in which you go to a place,staytherefor a short time, and then come back: chuyến đi
examples: We had a fantastic trip - the flight was fine and the hotel was perfect.
The trip to the coast took longer than we expected.

children.name: go on a trip
children.definition: go somewhere and come back
examples: I’ve been on a coach trip to France.

children.name: take a trip
children.definition: go somewhere for pleasure
examples: Take a trip on the Santa Fe railway or cruise on a Mississippi paddle boat.

children.name: make a trip
children.definition: go somewhere, and perhaps come back
examples: I couldn’t see him making the long trip to Minneapolis alone.

children.name: return trip
children.definition: when you are travelling back to where you started

children.name: I’m afraid you’ve had awasted trip
children.definition: a trip in which you do not achieve your purpose
examples: Mr Burgess has already left.

children.name: a business trip
examples: I’m on a business trip with my boss.

children.name: a shopping/fishing/skiing etc trip
examples: He was knocked off his bicycle on his way home from a shopping trip.

children.name: a school trip
children.definition: when children and teachers from a school go somewhere
examples: She went on a school trip to Tuscany.

children.name: a coach/bus/boat trip
examples: They took a boat trip to see the seals.

children.name: a day trip
children.definition: when you go somewhere for pleasure and come back the same day
examples: Take a day trip to York, which is just 15 miles away.

children.name: a round trip
children.definition: a journey to a place and back again
examples: His wife makes a hundred and fifty mile round trip to see him twice a week.

children.name: the return trip
children.definition: the journey back to a place
examples: A day or two later she began her return trip to Chicago.

children.name: a wasted trip
children.definition: a trip in which you do not achieve what you wanted to
examples: I’m afraid you’ve had a wasted trip. We don’t have those shoes in stock.

children.name: on a triptaking a trip
examples: My husband’s away on a business trip in China.

children.name: trip to/ from
examples: Did you enjoy your trip to Disneyland?
The Palace is only a short trip from here.

children.name: a two-hour/five-mile etc tripUS
examples: It’s only a three-hour trip by plane to Seattle.

children.name: a road tripUS a long trip in a car
examples: My friend and I took several road trips to New York City.

children.name: tour
children.definition: 1a journey for pleasure, during which you visit several different towns, areas etc: chuyến du lịch
examples: tour of/around/round
a 10-day tour of China
a walking/cycling/sightseeing etc tour
a cycling tour of Cornwall
We met on a coach tour in Italy.
a package tourplanned holiday with all costs included : trọn gói
They like to take package tours because they hate dealing with details.
2a short trip through a place to see it : chuyến thăm
tour of/around/round
aguided touraround the Kennedy Space Center
Kim worked as atour guidein Cambridge last summer.
3a planned journey made by musicians, a sports team etc in order to perform or play in several places : chuyến lưu diễn
tour of
the England cricket team’s tour of India
on tour
The Moscow Symphony Orchestra is here on tour.
Norton is on tour promoting her new children’s book.
a leg of a tourpart of a tour
The last leg of the tour will take the team to Dallas.
the firstleg ofthe band’s Europeantour

children.name: expedition
children.definition: a short journey, usually made for a particular purposeSYN trip: cuộc hành trình
examples: a shopping expedition
a fishing expedition

children.name: a shopping expedition
children.definition: when you go shopping
examples: I took Mary and the kids on a shopping expedition into Manchester.

children.name: a fishing expedition
examples: We’re organizing a fishing expedition to the lake for next week.

children.name: a hunting expedition
examples: He was joined on his hunting expedition by two local guides.

children.name: a foraging expedition
children.definition: when you search for food
examples: On our foraging expedition into the woods, we found mushrooms and wild berries.

children.name: go on an expedition
examples: We decided to go on a shopping expedition to London.

children.name: take someone on an expedition
examples: He’s taking the boys on a camping expedition next weekend.

children.name: travels
children.definition: journeys to places that are far away, usually for pleasure

children.name: sb’s travels
examples: We met some very interesting people on our travels in Thailand.
I’m longing to hear all about your travels in China.

children.name: a record of her travelsin/aroundthe Far East
day trip
children.definition: a visit to a beach, an area of countryside, a town etc when you go there and come back the same day:
examples: It would be nice to take a day trip to Chicago to do some shopping.
go out for the dayto visit a beach, an area of countryside, a town etc for pleasure and come back home on the same day:
It’s such a lovely day - let’s go out for the day and visit the zoo.
Do you fancy comingona day trip to Bath next Saturday?

children.name: outing
children.definition: a short journey on which agroup of peoplego to visit alocalplaceof interest, the theatre etc: chuyến tham quan, du ngoạn
examples: a family/school/ church etc outing
a class outing to the ballet
outing to
an outing to the beach
on an outing
They hadgone on an outingto the pool for Robert’s birthday.
Rosie'sgoing ona class/school outingtothe Museum of Modern Art.

children.name: excursion
children.definition: a short journey arranged so that a group of people can visit a place of interest, especially while they are already on holiday: chuyến tham quan , du ngoạn
examples: The resort also offers daily excursions to nearby towns.

children.name: excursion to
examples: Included in the tour is an excursion to the Grand Canyon.

children.name: on an excursion
examples: We went on an excursion to the Pyramids.
Next week we're going on an excursion.

children.name: go out for the day U
children.definition: go out for the day to visit a beach, an area of countryside, a town etc for pleasure and come back home on the same day: đi chơi trong ngày
examples: ▪ It’s such a lovely day - let’s go out for the day and visit the zoo.

children.name: expedition
children.definition: a long and carefully organized journey, especially to a dangerous or unfamiliar place, or the people that make this journey: cuộc viễn chinh, thám hiểm
examples: an expedition to the North Pole
another Everest expedition
on an expedition
Hewent onanexpeditionto Borneo.

children.name: go on an expedition
examples: After the war, Swainson went on an expedition to Patagonia.

children.name: make an expedition
children.definition: go on an expedition
examples: The men made expeditions to Spain, Greece and Asia Minor to find fossils.

children.name: set off on an expedition
children.definition: alsoembark on an expeditionformal
examples: (= leave at the start of an expedition )Trent set off on an expedition to collect plants with fellow botanical students.

children.name: mount/launch an expedition
children.definition: plan, organize, and begin an expedition
examples: Ornithologists are mounting an expedition to the island in order to study the birds.

children.name: a scientific expedition
examples: He led the first major British scientific expedition to the Amazon.

children.name: an
examples: Arctic/Antarctic expeditionI accompanied the explorer on one of his Arctic expeditions.

children.name: a military expedition
examples: The generals decided to launch a military expedition to the region.

children.name: a punitive expedition
children.definition: one an army undertakes to punish someone
examples: The Afghan army mounted a punitive expedition against the local militia groups.

children.name: trek
children.definition: a long anddifficultjourney, for example overmountainsor throughforests, especially when you arewalking. Some people also go on treks forinterestandenjoyment:
examples: The team is preparing for a two week trek across the Atlas Mountains.

children.name: a two-week trek across the Atlas Mountains
adventure
children.definition: an unusual, exciting and possibly dangerous activity such as a journey or experience, or the excitement produced by such an activity: chuyến phiêu lưu, cuộc thám hiểm
examples: Shehadsome exciting adventures in Egypt.
We got lost on the Metro - it wasquite anadventure.
Sam won't come - he's got nosense ofadventure (= he does not enjoy dangerous or exciting situations) .

children.name: stopover
children.definition: nounUK(USlayover)sự dừngchân

children.name: a short stay in a place that you make while you are on a longer journey to somewhereelse
examples: _Our tickets toAustraliainclude a stopover for two nights inSingapore.

children.name: voyage
children.definition: a long journey in a ship or spacecraft: chuyến du hành
examples: The voyage from England to India used to take six months.

children.name: the Titanic’smaiden voyage(= first journey )
examples: I don’t want tomakethevoyagesingle-handed.
These are the voyages of the starship Enterprise.
He was a young sailoronhis first sea voyage.
